name: "Man", I Love a Good Movie Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: What movie comes to mind when you hear about a six-foot tall invisible rabbit?
questions.explanation:
Harvey.

	"Harvey" was a movie that came out in 1950 and starred the great James Stewart. Stewart played Elwood P. Dowd, a man everyone believed to be crazy because he had the ability to see Harvey. Harvey was an invisible six-foot tall rabbit.

questions.text: In the movie "What's Eating Gilbert Grape?", who plays Gilbert Grape's mentally challenged brother, Arnie?
questions.explanation:
Leonardo DiCaprio.

	All of these actors were in "What's Eating Gilbert Grape?". Johnny Depp played Gilbert Grape. Kevin Tighe played Ken Carver, and Crispin Glover played Bobby McBurney. Leonardo DiCaprio was nominated for an Oscar for his portrayal of Arnie. Leonardo DiCaprio has also been in the TV show "Growing Pains" as Luke, a boy found by Mike Seaver who ends up living with the Seavers. He's since been in many movies, including "Titanic" and "The Man in the Iron Mask".

questions.text: Who was the first man to play the part of Albus Dumbledore in the "Harry Potter" series of movies?
questions.explanation:
Richard Harris.

	In the first two movies, Dumbledore was played by Richard Harris. Sadly, on October 25, 2002, Harris died from Hodgkin's lymphoma. In the rest of the movies, Dumbledore was played by Michael Gambon.  Richard Harris was in many films, including playing King Arthur in "Camelot" and English Bob in "Unforgiven". He was born in Limerick, Ireland on October 1, 1930.

questions.text: What is the name of Chucky's partner, the bridal doll, in "Bride of Chucky"?
questions.explanation:
Tiffany.

	Tiffany was played by Jennifer Tilly in this, one of many sequels to "Child's Play". Chucky and Tiffany have an interesting relationship - both are serial killers, and both have killed each other at various times.

questions.text: In the 2003 version of "Peter Pan", Hook tells Pan, "If I were you, I'd give up." How does Peter Pan respond?
questions.correct: "If you were me, I'd be ugly."
options: "If you were me, I'd be a pirate."
"If you were me, I'd be fat."
"If you were me, I'd be old."
questions.explanation:
"If you were me, I'd be ugly."

	Peter Pan was played by Jeremy Sumpter. Captain Hook was played by Jason Issacs who also played Mr. Darling. The character of Peter Pan was first introduced in 1902 by J.M. Barrie in a novel called, "The Little White Bird". Pan says this to Hook after Tiger Lily is saved. He had been impersonating Hook to get the pirates to free her, John and Michael. Hook hears this and they have a sword fight. Hook thinks he has Pan and tells him, "If I were you, I'd give up." Pan's witty response is, "If you were me, I'd be ugly."

questions.text: Johnny Depp played the title role in the musical "Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street". Did he do the actual singing?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Not only did Johnny Depp do his own singing, the entire cast did. One of the disappointing aspects of this film is that "The Ballad of Sweeney Todd" was only an instrumental in the film. This was due to the fact that in the movie everything could be seen, where on a stage the Greek Chorus was needed to narrate parts of the story that couldn't be seen.

questions.text: In the movie "Weekend at Bernie's", Bernie is dead, but how did he die?
options: He fell down a flight of stairs.
questions.explanation:
He was murdered.

	This hilarious movie focuses on two men trying to make people think Bernie is still alive at a party. Bernie was played by Terry Kiser.  Bernie was having an affair with his mafia partner's wife, so the partner had him killed.

questions.text: In the movie "Wayne's World", what is Wayne's last name?
questions.explanation:
Campbell.

	Wayne Campbell and Garth Algar were played by Mike Myers and Dana Carvey. These characters were originally created for a skit on the show "Saturday Night Live".

questions.text: "Free Willy" contains a man's name, but Willy is not a man. He is a killer whale. What is the name of the trained whale that plays him?
questions.explanation:
Keiko.

	Keiko died of pneumonia on December 12, 2003. He was 27 years old. This movie helped bring a lot of attention to the preservation of killer whales.

questions.text: In the movie "Forrest Gump", what does Jenny die from?
questions.explanation:
It is not stated.

	It is believed that she dies from an AIDS related illness. This is based on the fact that she says that little is known about the illness she has, and there is no cure. At the time in the movie when she dies, AIDS was a relatively new disease. Since Jenny had many lovers, and used drugs, it is possible that AIDS was the cause of her death.
